benchmark_details.name: ScreenParse
benchmark_details.overview: ScreenParse is a rigorously constructed benchmark to systematically assess structural perception capabilities of GUI models across diverse scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an evaluation for the performance of models in both locating specific elements and perceiving the overall structure of user interfaces.

data.source: Open-source datasets and self-annotated Chinese datasets, including elements from common applications.
data.annotation: Annotated with element types, semantic labels, and bounding boxes through a combination of automated and manual processes.

methodology.calculation: Element recall is the ratio of correctly localized elements to the total number of ground truth elements, while element precision is the ratio of correctly localized elements to the total number of predicted elements.
methodology.interpretation: Higher recall indicates an effective model in identifying elements, while higher precision means fewer incorrect localizations.
